Subject: Preamble
data: 1 The Constitution of India borrowed the scheme of Indian Federation from the Constitution of A Ireland B UK C Canada D USA Answer: Option [C]
2 Which one of the following Constitutional System India follows ? A USA B UK C Switzerland D Russia Answer: Option [B]
3 The inspiration of 'Liberty, Equality and Fraternity' was derived from A American revolution B Russian revolution C French revolution D Italy revolution Answer: Option [C]
4 Which one of the following describes India as a secular state ? A Fundamental Rights B Directive Principles of State Policy C Fifth Schedule D Preamble of the Constitution Answer: Option [D]

5 In a parliamentary form of government, real powers of the State are vested in the A President B Chief Justice of Supreme Court C Council of Ministers headed by the Prime Minister D Parliament Answer: Option [C]
6 The Constitution of India has borrowed Fundamental duties from which one of the following countries ? A Canada B Erstwhile USSR C UK D Ireland Answer: Option [B]

7 Which of the following statement describes that the Indian Constitution is federal ? A A written and rigid Constitution B An independent Judiciary C Distribution of powers between the Centre and States D Vesting of residuary powers with the Centre Answer: Option [C]

8 What is the meaning of Secularism ? A Freedom of worship to minorities B Suppression of Religions C A system of political and social philosophy that does not favour any particular religious faith D Separation of Religion from State Answer: Option [C]

9 Which among the following is true about Federal State ? A Centre is more powerful than States B States are more powerful than the Centre C Equal powers for Centre and States D A Presidential form of government functions Answer: Option [B]
10 The source of India's sovereignty lies in the : A President B Prime Minister C Directive Principles of State Policy D Preamble to the Constitution Answer: Option [D]
11 The Preamble of the Indian Constitution was for the first time amended by the A 24th Amendment B 42nd Amendment C 44th Amendment D None of the above Answer: Option [B]

12 Of the following words in the Preamble of the Constitution of India, which was not inserted through the Constitution (Forty Second Amendment) Act, 1976 ? A Socialist B Secular C Dignity D Integrity Answer: Option [C]
13 Which one of the following is not mentioned in the Preamble to the Constitution of India ? A Justice B Fraternity C Adult franchise D Equality of position Answer: Option [C]

14 The Preamble of our Constitution reads India as A Socialist, Democratic, Secular Republic B Democratic, Sovereign, Secular, Socialist Republic C Sovereign, Democratic, Socialist, Secular Republic D Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic Republic Answer: Option [D]
15 Who proposed the Preamble before the drafting committee of the Constitution ? A Jawaharlal Nehru B B.R. Ambedkar C B.N. Rao D Mahatma Gandhi Answer: Option [A]
16 According to Preamble, the ultimate power lies in hands of: A President B Parliament C People D Constitution Answer: Option [C]
17 The Preamble of the Indian Constitution makes no mention of A Fraternity B Equality of status C Justice D Adult franchise Answer: Option [D]
